title: gmcSCRB-seq protocol

authors.name: Swati Parekh
authors.affiliation: Max Planck Institute for Biology of Ageing

source.description: Prepare 96 well plate(s) containing 5 μL Lysis Buffer per well.

source.body: Lysis plates should be prepared shortly before use, but can be stored for up to 1 week at room temperature. Prior to use, double check to make sure salts have not fallen out of solution or that the lysis buffer has not evaporated.

source.description:
Prepare Lysis Buffer for the number of plates needed.
AB
1Reagent96-well plate
28M Guanadine Hydrochloride343.75
32-mercaptoethanol5.5
4NEB HF Phusion buffer (5x)1.1
5H2O199.65
6Total 550

source.body: Note that 96-well plates are the preferred setup for gmcSCRB-seq, as the well cleanup (Step 9-15) would be more difficult with 384-well plates.

source.description:
AB
1Reagent96-well plate
28M Guanadine Hydrochloride343.75
32-mercaptoethanol5.5
4NEB HF Phusion buffer (5x)1.1
5H2O199.65
6Total 550
Sort 1 cell to each well of a 96 well plate containing 5 μL Lysis Buffer.
Immediately seal the plate with an aluminium cold storage seal.
In a cooled centrifuge, spin down the plate for 30 sec @ max. speed and place immediately on dry ice.

source.title: Store plates containing single-cell lysates in a -80 °C freezer for up to 6 months.

source.description: Thaw plates briefly (up to 1 min) at room temperature
Spin down (30 sec @ 1000 rcf) in a centrifuge pre-cooled to 4 °C.
Add 10 uL of Clean-up Beads to each well (1:2 ratio).

Prepare Reverse Transcription Mix as follows:
AB
1 Reagent 96-well plate
2UltraPure Water88 μL
3PEG 8000
(50 % solution)		165 μL
4Maxima RT Buffer (5x) 220 μL
5dNTPs (25 mM each)44 μL
6TSO E5V6NEXT
unblocked (100 μM)		22 μL
7Maxima H Minus RT
(200 U/μl)  		11 μL
8Total 550 μL

AB
1 Reagent 96-well plate
2UltraPure Water88 μL
3PEG 8000
(50 % solution)		165 μL
4Maxima RT Buffer (5x) 220 μL
5dNTPs (25 mM each)44 μL
6TSO E5V6NEXT
unblocked (100 μM)		22 μL
7Maxima H Minus RT
(200 U/μl)  		11 μL
8Total 550 μL

source.body:
- RT MM can be prepared while plate is incubating or while drying on magnet.
- If ERCCs will be used, decrease the amount of H2O and add appropriate amount of ERCCs.
- Caution: Reverse Transcription Mix with PEG needs to be mixed carefully!

source.title: Keep Reverse Transcription Mix on ice

source.description: Add 5 μL Reverse Transcription Mix to each well.

source.body: If a robot (eg. Formulatrix Mantis) is used, make sure to calibrate correctly to the viscous solution.

source.description: Seal plate with a PCR seal, vortex briefly and spin down (30 sec @ 1000 rcf) in a centrifuge pre-cooled to 4 °C.
In a thermocycler with heated lid, incubate:
Pool all wells (including beads) of one plate into a 2 mL tube and add 960 μL (ratio 1/1) Bead Binding Buffer

source.body: Vortex to mix the sample and bead binding buffer.

source.title: binding of the cDNA onto the beads

source.description: Place on magnet stand until clear
Discard supernatant
Wash twice with 2 mL 80% ethanol (while on magnet) and discard supernatant
Elute cDNA in 17 μL UltraPure Water & transfer to new tube

source.body: Avoid transfering beads as these can inhibit the downstream PCR.

source.description: To the 17 μl cDNA, add:
In a thermocycler with heated lid, incubate:

Prepare PreAmplification Mix as follows:
AB
1Reagent1x
2Terra direct Buffer (2x) 25 μL
3SINGV6 Primer (10 μM) 1 μL
4Terra polymerase (1.25 U/μL) 1 μL
5UltraPure Water 3 μL
6Total 30 μL

AB
1Reagent1x
2Terra direct Buffer (2x) 25 μL
3SINGV6 Primer (10 μM) 1 μL
4Terra polymerase (1.25 U/μL) 1 μL
5UltraPure Water 3 μL
6Total 30 μL
Add 30 µL of PreAmplification Mix directly to the Exonuclease I digested sample.

In a thermocycler with heated lead, incubate as follows:
ABCD
1StepTemperatureTimeCycles
2Initial Denaturation98 °C3 min1x
3Denaturation98 °C15 sec   13-21x
4Annealing65 °C30 sec
5Elongation68 °C4 min
6Final Elongation72 °C10 min   1x
7Store8 °C∞

ABCD
1StepTemperatureTimeCycles
2Initial Denaturation98 °C3 min1x
3Denaturation98 °C15 sec   13-21x
4Annealing65 °C30 sec
5Elongation68 °C4 min
6Final Elongation72 °C10 min   1x
7Store8 °C∞

source.body: Cylce number highly depends on the input amount and should be optimized depending on the specific celltype used in the experiment. For ES cells, 13-15 cycles are sufficient.

source.description:
Prepare Clean-up Beads:
AB
1 ReagentAmount
2PEG 800011 g
3NaCl, 5M 10 mL
4Tris-HCL, 1M, pH 8.0 500 μL
5EDTA, 0.5M 100 μL
6IGEPAL, 10% solution 50 μL
7Sodium Azide, 10% solution 250 μL
8UltraPure Waterup to 49 mL
9Total 49 mL
-Add all ingredients into a 50 mL falcon tube, but do not add the total amount of water until after PEG is completely solubilized -Incubate at 40°C and vortex regularly until PEG is completely dissolved - Resuspend bead stock carefully (Sera-Mag Speed Beads) - Pipette 1000 μL of bead suspension into a 1.5 mL tube - Place on magnet stand -Remove supernatant -Add 1000 μL 10 mM Tris-HCl, pH 8.0, 1 mM EDTA (TE), and resuspend beads -Place on magnet stand -Remove supernatant -Repeat wash one more time -Add 900 μL 10 mM Tris-HCl, pH 8.0, 1 mM EDTA (TE), and resuspend beads -Add to PEG solution above and mix well.

AB
1 ReagentAmount
2PEG 800011 g
3NaCl, 5M 10 mL
4Tris-HCL, 1M, pH 8.0 500 μL
5EDTA, 0.5M 100 μL
6IGEPAL, 10% solution 50 μL
7Sodium Azide, 10% solution 250 μL
8UltraPure Waterup to 49 mL
9Total 49 mL

source.body: Beads should be prepared ahead of time and can be stored at 4 °C or room temperature.

source.description: Mix PreAmplification PCR with 40 μL Clean-up Beads (1/0.8 ratio)

source.title: binding of the cDNA onto the beads

source.description: Place on magnet until clear and discard supernatant
Wash twice with 150 µL 80% ethanol (while on magnet) and discard supernatant
Elute cDNA in 15 μL UltraPure Water & transfer to new tube
Quantify the cDNA using the Quant-iT PicoGreen dsDNA assay kit or equivalent Qubit following the manufacturer's protocol. Use 1 μl of clean cDNA for quantification.

source.body: cDNA concentration should be > 1 ng/μl, depending on cell type and cycle number

source.description: Optional: Quality check the cDNA using the Agilent 2100 Bioanalyzer with High Sensitivity DNA Analysis Kits.

Prepare Tagmentation Mix and dispense 19 μL to a new 96-well plate.
AB
1Reagent1x
2Tagment DNA Buffer (2x) 10 μL
3Amplicon Tagment Mix (Tn5) 5 μL
4UltraPure Water 4 μL
5Total 19 μL

AB
1Reagent1x
2Tagment DNA Buffer (2x) 10 μL
3Amplicon Tagment Mix (Tn5) 5 μL
4UltraPure Water 4 μL
5Total 19 μL
Dilute cDNA to 0.8 ng/µL and add 1 µL to each reaction.
In a thermocycler with heated lid, incubate as follows:
To stop the reaction, add 5 μL NT buffer to each reaction and mix by pipetting up and down.

Prepare 3' Enrichment PCR Mix as follows and add 24.5 µL to each tagmentation reaction.
AB
1Reagent1x
2NPM PCR Mix 15 μL
3P5NEXTPT5 (5 μM) 0.5 μL
4UltraPure Water 9 μL
5Total 24.5 μL

AB
1Reagent1x
2NPM PCR Mix 15 μL
3P5NEXTPT5 (5 μM) 0.5 μL
4UltraPure Water 9 μL
5Total 24.5 μL
Add 0.5 μL of i7 index primer (5 μM)

In a thermocycler with heated lead, incubate as follows:
ABCD
1StepTemperatureTimeCycles
2Gap-fill72 °C3 min  
1x
3Initial Denaturation95 °C30 sec
4Denaturation95 °C10 sec   13x
5Annealing55 °C30 sec
6Elongation72 °C1 min
7Final Elongation72 °C5 min   1x
8Store8 °C∞

ABCD
1StepTemperatureTimeCycles
2Gap-fill72 °C3 min  
1x
3Initial Denaturation95 °C30 sec
4Denaturation95 °C10 sec   13x
5Annealing55 °C30 sec
6Elongation72 °C1 min
7Final Elongation72 °C5 min   1x
8Store8 °C∞
Mix Index PCR with 50 μL Clean-up Beads (1/1 ratio)

source.title: binding of DNA onto the beads

source.description: Place on magnet until clear and discard supernatant
Wash twice with 150 µL 80% ethanol (while on magnet) and discard supernatant
Elute cDNA in 20 μL UltraPure Water & transfer to new tube
Load complete library onto an 2% Agarose E-Gel EX and run for 10 minutes.
As soon as the Gel run has finished open the Gel framing using the Gel opening tool
Excise the Library from 300bp to 900bp using a clean scalpel

Gel purify the slice using the Qiagen MinElute Kit following manufacturer's guidelines:
  • Add 450 µL Buffer QG
  • Dissolve the gel slice in QG for 10 min @ 42 °C
  • Add 150 μL Isopropanol to the sample and mix by inverting
  • Transfer sample to spin column and centrifuge at 16 000 x g for 1 min
  • Discard flow through and add 500 μL Buffer QG
  • Centrifuge at 16 000 x g for 1 min and discard flow through
  • Add 700 μL Buffer PE
  • Centrifuge at 16 000 x g for 1 min and discard flow through
  • Centrifuge again at 16 000 x g for 1 min to remove residual ethanol
  • Transfer column to a new 1.5 mL microcentrifuge tube
  • Add 20 μL H2O to column and incubate for 1 min
  • Centrifuge at 16 000 x g for 1 min to elute and discard the spin column

source.body: The Monarch DNA Gel Extraction Kit (NEB T1020L) can also be used.

source.description:
Quantify and quality control the library using the Agilent 2100 Bioanalyzer with High Sensitivity DNA Analysis Kits.
Load both the library and a 1/10 dilution on two different lanes of the chip.

source.body: If cDNA was not quality controlled previously, it is strongly suggested to run cDNA on the same chip.
Successful libraries will typically exceed 3-5 ng/μl concentration.

source.description: If pooling several libraries, combine equal molar amounts.

Sequence your library on any compatible Illumina sequencer.
Dilute libraries to recommended molarity according to Illumina's recommendations (eg. 2 nM).
Select the following paired-end read-length settings:
ABC
1ReadCyclesContent
2Read 116Cell barcode & UMI
3Index 18i7 Index
4Index 20 
5Read 250cDNA fragment

ABC
1ReadCyclesContent
2Read 116Cell barcode & UMI
3Index 18i7 Index
4Index 20 
5Read 250cDNA fragment
Download and install zUMIs including all dependencies.
Copy the sequencing data from the sequencer and run bcl2fastq without demultiplexing.

Run zUMIs by specifying your parameters in the associated yaml file or using the
YAML config Rshiny application
. Below is an example yaml file for a typical gmcSCRB-seq run.

source.name:
project: Example_project_name
sequence_files:
  file1:
    name: /data/R2.fq.gz
    base_definition: BC(1-8)
  file2:
    name: /data/R1.fq.gz
    base_definition:
    - BC(1-6)
    - UMI(7-16)
  file3:
    name: /data/R3.fq.gz
    base_definition: cDNA(1-50)
reference:
  STAR_index: /data/STAR5idx
  GTF_file: /data/Species.gtf
  additional_STAR_params: ''
  additional_files: /data/ERCC92.fa
out_dir: /data/zUMIs
num_threads: 15
mem_limit: 0
filter_cutoffs:
  BC_filter:
    num_bases: 1
    phred: 20
  UMI_filter:
    num_bases: 1
    phred: 20
barcodes:
  barcode_num: ~
  barcode_file: /data/bc.txt
  automatic: no
  BarcodeBinning: 0
  nReadsperCell: 100
counting_opts:
  introns: yes
  downsampling: '0'
  strand: 0
  Ham_Dist: 0
  velocyto: no
  primaryHit: yes
  twoPass: yes
make_stats: yes
which_Stage: Filtering
Rscript_exec: Rscript
STAR_exec: STAR
pigz_exec: pigz
samtools_exec: samtools
zUMIs_directory: /data/zUMIs2/zUMIs
read_layout: SE

source.description: Seal the plate and vortex to mix the bead-lysate mixture. Briefly spin down the plate (<200 rcf, <10 sec) so all of the mixture is at the bottom of the well but the beads are still in solution.

source.body: Depending on lab temperature and humidity, drying times can vary.

source.description: Wash twice with 50 uL 80% ethanol (while on magnet) and discard supernatant
Discard supernatant
Place on magnet stand until clear
Incubate for 5 minutes at RT.

source.title: binding of the cDNA onto the beads

source.description: Once drying is complete, add 4 μL H2O to each well.
Add 1 μL of barcoded oligo-dT primer [2 μM] (E3V6NEXT adapter) to each well.
Vortex to mix the bead-cDNA mixture. Briefly spin down the plate (<200 rcf, <10 sec) so all of the mixture is at the bottom of the well but the beads are still in solution.

Prepare Bead Binding Buffer
AB
1ReagentAmount
2PEG 800011 g
3NaCl, 5M 10 mL
4Tris-HCL, 1M, pH 8.0 500 μL
5EDTA, 0.5M 100 μL
6IGEPAL, 10% solution 50 μL
7Sodium Azide, 10% solution 250 μL
8UltraPure Waterup to 50 mL
9Total 50 mL
-Add all ingredients into a 50 mL falcon tube, but do not add the total amount of water until after PEG is completely solubilized -Incubate at 40°C and vortex regularly until PEG is completely dissolved

AB
1ReagentAmount
2PEG 800011 g
3NaCl, 5M 10 mL
4Tris-HCL, 1M, pH 8.0 500 μL
5EDTA, 0.5M 100 μL
6IGEPAL, 10% solution 50 μL
7Sodium Azide, 10% solution 250 μL
8UltraPure Waterup to 50 mL
9Total 50 mL

description: gmcSCRB-seq is an alternative lysis protocol to mcSCRB-seq (Publication and Protocol). gmcSCRB-seq uses Guanidine Hydrochloride in the lysis buffer and requires an additional cean up step. We recommend using this alternative lysis protocol in cases where cells are difficult to lyse or where the DNA appears degraded following the pre-amplification step. However, we have observed reduced sensitivity with gmcSCRB-seq compared to mcSCRB-seq and would therefore only recommend using it in cases where the latter does not produce high quality libraries.
